page.title: 07ST.MARY'S CHURCH, CLAXBY
page.content: St. Mary's Church site goes back to before 1110's. It is in the diocese of Lincoln and part of the Arch Deaconary of Stow in the West Wold Deanery. United approximately 20 years ago with the Walesby Group of Churches under the Rector of Walesby it receives little pastoral care at present, with only two services a month. Average attendance of these are: Holy Communion 20, Evensong 12. There are two churchwardens who look after general running of church. There are 12 members on the Parochial Church Council and 30 on the Church Electoral Roll. The church has five fine bells, some with inscriptions on and a good set of hand bells, but alas no one at present to ring them. On the interior wall there is a memorial to those lost in two world wars, also to those who returned from war to Claxby.
